Instrument.name: 2001 Mars Odyssey Spacecraft Accelerometer
Instrument.description: The 2001 Mars Odyssey Spacecraft Accelerometer measured forces acting on the spacecraft, providing key data on its motion and orientation. It helped track any deviations from the planned flight path, ensuring the spacecraft remained on course for Mars. The instrument also supported data on the spacecraft's stability during maneuvers and its entry into Mars' orbit. Its measurements were vital for mission control to fine-tune trajectory adjustments and optimize mission performance.
